Blog.post: Someone should do us all a favour and shoot these urlLink clowns from Sweden. Changing your bad suits, boys, will not change the fact that your music and theatrics are ridiculous. Do you have the time, to listen to me whine?

Even Republica's Saffron knows ISDN sucks. Not bad for pop band. Then you do the search for the links and you'll find nothing but shit regarding Republica and ISDN . The latter I have no problem with, but the former?
As you do ... btw: I'm sure that what what I want to do will break what is allowed .

Look at my friends they're always laughing Think they're doing alright Maybe it's me they think they're fooling It's a general insight Who knows what you see Maybe it's lies, all lies She gave me a kiss like judas Crowning the clown on his merry-go-round She gave me a kiss like Judas Who wears the crown when your head's on the ground So glad you could make it Beast and Beauty way up high Cold pains of Sanctuary It helps to make up my disguise But water, she gave me water, so I gave her the use of my life Is it the chip on my shoulder Or the hunch on my back that's as sharp as a knife?

And I quote: The following urlLink HTML elements specify font information. Although they are not all deprecated, their use is discouraged in favor of style sheets. Really? Could you make it more complex? urlLink troff , albeit arcane, was used first to write Patents. In urlLink troff to get a 12pt font all I need is: .pt 12 .vs 14 And no fuckin' style sheets .

On today's food run I found three pieces of physical mail threatening hanging, drawing and quartering if I didn't pay various large financial institutions various sums of money. Well, it ain't gonna work. I know a bit about this debt collection nonsense and French Law. I even used to have conversations with someone who did this for a job and worked in a shared office where the debt chasers worked. I find the bold font in UPPER CASE in their letters ever so scary . One debt chaser was so clever to call me at 0433 [local] thinking I'd be awake, asking me to call him back. Sorry? If I haven't paid you it's because I can't. Do you think it's good economics for me to waste more money, on international phone calls, so I can listen to a lot of shit while making my financial state worse . If that maniac Branson can afford to build some Bond style car to drive across the channel, well he can bung me a few quid. If they really want the money they can email urlLink Laura Creighton .

Apparently, according to urlLink The Daily Telegraph , urlLink Intel [the perpetrators of that ghastly x86 architecture ] have added Web, email and other Internet services to a surfboard. Therein lies madness.
Thank the urlLink BBC that urlLink BBC Prime is showing no soccer.

Yesterday, I headed off to an interview with a mob who specialise in helping out unemployable types, like myself. It was looking not so great 'cos I know my industry [computers] pretty well and have worked in it for some 22 years, in various countries, in various languages [human and programming]. So, I was less than pleased about going, but Article 311-3-4 du Code du Travail (of which I have a copy) is a fairly compelling reason. On the up-side I only had to take Métro line 4 to Château d'Eau, which is 5 minutes away, but on the down-side I was going to enter le 10è . I fuckin' hate le 10è . As I egressed the Métro, by escalator, I see 8-10 black guys, of southern African descent, yelling in some language which was not French or any other language I could recognise. I was somewhat perplexed. Being seen to be an American can stir up all sorts of shit and I dress like one, although I did have my urlLink ENIGMA baseball cap on. Me, being first on the the escalator wondered whether it was directed at me, so I just resorted to the ignore them and show no fear policy. So, nothing happened. I then crossed the road and saw the same fucking scene . The interview wasn't a waste of time, but next time I'm getting off at Cadet.

This clown ran as an MEP. I have a few words of advice: Stick to what you know. Go back to that 'orrible chat show that you used to do, in the morning, on the urlLink BBC . Don't preach about things you know nothing about (ie. the EU). Hypocrisy doesn't work; running as an MEP to shut the EU down? Shut the fuck up!
I finally, after months (maybe a year), re-organised my Web site bookmarks ... But, only at the top level.

I'm now, officially, a non-person. I had it confirmed by the beslut and by L , a native speaker. I no longer belong to the folkbokföringen (which is a tautology 'cos I don't need the the because it ends in en ). This should be interesting.

I can't vote in the EU elections 'cos I'm not a citizen and I can't vote little Johnny out in the Oz elections because non-residents can't vote. WTF? Not even embassy officials can vote and it's the bloody LAW that Australians must vote. I think it's a good LAW , although I'm not real keen on LAW s.

Bad news: I owe a large financial institution a reasonably large sum of money. Good news: I understand the relevant laws and confirmed that I did. The reply stated: I advise that it is uncommon for an [deleted] creditor to commence debt recovery action against a debtor who resides overseas.
So they messed with: <blockquote> too? So I convinced it 'round to my way of thinking .

There will be no fuckups , not on my watch . Today I was told that a job I was interviewed for on Monday had already been taken or I didn't look like a good candidate. The original interview was set up for the previous Thursday, but no-one turned up. Perhaps those few days made the difference? The past participle used was pourvu : provided for Could this be less clear?
There is no work. There is no work. There is no work. There is no work. There is no fucking work!! And I'm sick of fucking chasing it ...
When you hear a native English speaker pronounce j and you write down g .

Yesterday, I saw urlLink Yes urlLink au Zenith and they were truly amazing . They played 2 sets and one encore (some 3 hours worth). The lineup was Anderson/Howe/Squire/Wakeman/White. It was good to see Rick play again. Alan had this enormous drumkit (except for the acoustic stuff) and played it magnificently which reminded me of a story Cozy Powell told of a steel drumkit which weighed one [imperial] ton, when he was touring with ELP. Chris had the usual thundering bass with almost infinite sustain . Those nu-metal boys coulda learnt a lot by watching these guys. Jon, Steve and Rick? What can I say? Perfect. The 1st set was 1 hour 15 minutes, consisting of: Going For The One Sweet Dreams All Good People unknown [reminiscent of White Rabbit] South Side Of The Sky All These Many Years Ago Glory Of The World [new one?] Your's Is No Disgrace The 2nd set was 1 hour 25 minutes, consisting of: The Meeting Long Distance Runaround Time Is Time [played as a homage to the fans ] Roundabout [Chicago shuffle style] unknown Owner Of a Lonely Heart Steve Howe acoustic solo Rhythm Of Love Ritual The first 5 were acoustic. It was interesting to observe that Steve did not play any of those horrible Rabin solos. Some of Rabin's demos are interesting, but the bad guitar god syndrome does not impress Steve, Chris nor I. When I saw them first, in New York in 1984, I remember Chris walking across the stage and crashing into Rabin just as he was to kick into another appalling solo -- it worked [no solo]. Encore: Starship Trooper I'll see if I can fill in the unknowns later. I also have a new urlLink Yes baseball cap to replace the one I lost in Sweden:
The sick SOB who did this should be shot. I've seen some bad stuff, but style shits sheets are one of the worst. Gimme urlLink troff(1) .
Well, it could be looming but the urlLink ITSA have a really good web site. Do some recon, before getting into it ...
Get fucked!

Those urlLink HTML fools have too much time on their hands. Despite this, I have tweaked my urlLink Blogger urlLink blog into a form I prefer. Read all that urlLink doc ? No chance. I'll read the raw urlLink Blogger template and make it come 'round to my way of thinking .

So I got some more today. These boys would seem to be halfway serious about it, so I think I'll negociate with 'em. They like that 'cos they understand the financial realities; if it goes to Court it gets expensive and you might not win. urlLink The Justice Game , by Geoffrey Robertson QC, is an excellent read. Then again, I could push their resolve. The worst case scenario is this: Un Hussier de Justice is sent to confiscate my material possessions, after various legal shenanigans They find my safe It needs a key It also needs a 5 digit code One of its contents is only allowed to be in my possession It would make for a fine argument and a certain amount of confusion
So, urlLink what does it ?

Well that's what was said to me the other night while my accuser was plying me with copious amounts of rum, in the the form of Rum Sunrises (aka: a thing ). So, should I be more tedious, more depressed or more manic (on the depressed side)? There's just no pleasing some people. Well, I did pay off some of my bar tab.

urlLink Madagascar ? So, this is the most recent, head-hunter proposed job offer. Fourteen flying hours from Paris and two hours ahead. This is probably another suicide mission , involving a lot of money which will be wasted on a lot of non-functional compute hardware and software. All I know is that it's a 6 months gig with 2 aller-retours to Paris.

Well this would seem to be my new potential profession. I basically have all pieces of paper and as long as I wear a urlLink Threat Level 3 vest and can use my urlLink M9 it should be a walk in the park.

I have just seen on urlLink Shooting Stars , with urlLink Ulrika-ka-ka , and George Dawes has just sung the theme to urlLink Happy Days in French. Now, that was bad, but have you ever seen it dubbed into French? This can not be a good sign, although it was better than this French prat wearing a urlLink Bay City Rollers t-shirt at my favourite bar. Some of it was too ugly to contemplate.

Roll into interview, wearing the urlLink suit [white shirt preferred] and slam my urlLink 9mm down, locked and loaded, on the the table and say: Give me the job! Of course, it breaks all the French Class 1 firearms ownership laws. An interesting idea, which would raise some pulses . But, ultimately stupid. The urlLink 9mm stays in the safe.

Is it really little george ? You created this tarpit : aka Iraq. Previously it was stable, but horrendous tyranny. Now it is an unstable, civil war which is ready to rock 'n roll come July 1 2004. I see many of the smart urlLink BBC journalists have been wearing their urlLink Threat Level 3 vests. Word of advice, little george : if you make a mess, clear it up; don't expect the rest of the world to do it.

Mickey Mouse! Donald Rumsfeld Duck! Forever let us hold our banners high! High! High! High! So the gig's up boys? You incompetent buffoons. No HUMINT assets, no INTEL , no nothing. Nothing but lies, which anyone, with half a brain, could have figured out on 9/11. Clusterfucks 'R Us eh? I'll give you a heads-up : Have a look at those North Koreans. Maybe, just maybe, they are up to no good? But hell, what would the people know? (softly) Now's the time to say goodbye To all our company Through the years we'll all be friends Wherever we may be M-I-C-K-E-Y M-O-U-S-E Mickey Mouse, Mickey Mouse ...

The Great Man ... is colder, harder, less hesitating, and without respect and without the fear of "opinion"; he lacks the virtues that accompany respect and "respectability", and altogether everything that is the "virtue of the herd". If he cannot lead, he goes alone. ... He knows he is incommunicable: he finds it tasteless to be familiar. ... When not speaking to himself, he wears a mask. There is a solitude within him that is inaccessible to praise or blame. -- Friedrich Nietzche, The Will to Power

So I saw urlLink it today, thanks to the people who had the guts to back its release, unlike the sissies who refused to release it. I more or less knew what it was going to see, but it was a shocker ; it was worse than I expected. The (mostly French) audience applauded at the end of it. It ends with Neil Young's urlLink Keep On Rockin' In The Free World . Freedom? In the USA? What a concept. As my mate Chris quotes: They who can give up essential liberty for temporary safety, deserve neither liberty nor safety. -- Benjamin Franklin

The presence of WMD [Area Denial Munitions + Nukes] was the very reason he decalred to go into Iraq and create the tarpit that it is now. Now, urlLink they may never be found . You fucking idiot. The irony being that the UK does have WMD [Nukes]. I hope there's a UK election soon, much as I despise the Tories.

I've just received some email from some entity who has been dealing with urlLink AB Strakt , to which I've replied. It seems that said entity agrees with my views expressed in urlLink Kill Strakt 1 and urlLink Kill Strakt 2 . So, maybe this strategy works?

The chances of seeing a general practitioner are near zero or involve waiting several months. At the Akuten , if you're in a hurry, complain of chest pain. At the Hospital's casualty [ER] department storm around screaming, in your native language, that you demand to be seen raht-now , using as much medical terminology as you know [ pulse-ox is a good term]. This approach avoids a 6 hour wait in an empty department for 3 stitches and has been demonstrated to get a 1 hour service in a packed department for 1 stitch [suture]. On last count, my head has 23 stitches (17 in one hit/fall). Make sure you have a private health fund before going to the Dentist. I'll stick to the French urlLink Sécu , tack .

It would seem that there is one somewhat further north than California. It's called Sweden. After filing a jämknig which informs the tax authorities that this is my final return and will not be earning more any income in the country. This, apparently, was lost as I am still out some 5000 SEK [~500 &euro] which they owe me and should have be restituted last November. This then forced me to then re-declare my 2003 income, which I was less than happy about, but it's not hard to do. Unfortunately, this seems to have snowballed into a flurry of forms, sent to my Paris address, in Swedish, asking my status and intentions and those of my dependents [zero]. The last one was from the urlLink tax department which I filled out, as best as I could, and wrote in English that I had no intention of ever returning to Sweden. But it was not to stop there. Now, I have to tell their horrendous urlLink health care system more or less the same information. The only up side on this is that I have to make the declaration: på heder och samvete which is the stupid title they give urlLink JAG in Sweden. You can check out any time you like. But you can never leave ...

In view of the ongoing risk of terrorist attacks, Australians in France are advised to be alert to their own security and keep themselves informed of developments that might affect their safety. The French Government's domestic terror alert level is at red (the second highest level in a four grade scale). And it shows. They're doing a good job, unlike certain countries I could mention.
This does not look like a walk in the urlLink park . I think I'll stay urlLink here .

That urlLink track , by urlLink The Corrs , has been getting a caning and I've even listened to it at urlLink la FNAC a bit. I pretty much had it worked out in my head how it goes. Tonight they played urlLink it on urlLink Parky and it was pretty much as I expected: Verse Dm F Chorus D C F A# [twice] G A# C F [palm muted] These are all power chord 5ths. So that's my achievement for the day.

Well, I bit the bullet this morning and wrote my lettre de motivation. I had been putting it off for days, but it's all part of the process involved in re-training me to get a job that pays at least 30% less than I get on the dole. I just don't get the math? The system requires, even for a fry cook at McDonalds, that you apply with une lettre de motivation, un CV and maybe a photo. Sometimes la lettre must even be written by hand so that graphology can be employed to analyse if you're suitable. My plan: read my fucking CV. Even if I did want to be a fry cook at MacDo I'd have a hard time explaining why I would choose this as a career choice. This is the purpose of la lettre de motivation . I had a career , but now my industry [computer systems] is fucked . Maybe I did forget about the $US 21k I hid under the futon. Then again, maybe not ... Methinks "maybe not" 'cos I have a safe or maybe I just chucked it out the window one day.

The Shittybank urlLink Citibank 's debt collectors have asked me to find $US 21 0000 in the next few days. Yeah, sure I have $US lying around in the apartment in huge piles. They suggested that I ask my family or friends for the cash. I'm sure they're more than cashed up and more than willing (should I deem to ask) to lend me such a trivial sum. Well no. These banks [ urlLink Citibank being involved in the current police action in Iraq] I have little sympathy for.
The growing consciousness is a danger and a disease. -- Friedrich Nietzsche

What idiot decided that backspace should take you back an urlLink HTML page? It's right above urlLink CR [Carriage Return] (sometimes called enter). This means, that sometimes, while bashing out some urlLink HTML form, box, page etc you might miss. This chucks everything you have typed in the trash. You may have been typing trash, but losing it is worse.

What's the matter with being a loner and innovative? Isn't that fine? But the [lone genius] has the same wishes as other people. If he were back in high school doing science projects, fine. But if he's too isolated and he's disappointed in something big, it's frightening, and fright can precipitate depression. -- Paul Howard, McLean Hospital
Vive la revolution!!

I hate that word, but it keeps the marketroids occupied. I've wasted enough time been paid to work on a project that was a precursor of urlLink WAP , then laughed at and cursed things such as urlLink GPRS and urlLink 3G mobile data. Fuck that noise, Jack. Right now, I'm eating pistachios, drinking red [Bordeaux] and listening to various stuff on one of my laptops. There's no CD involved as I've cut various CDs I own down as 160Kbit/s urlLink MP3 s and they break up , very much like any mobile call you might have had. Even if it's in simple 4/4 time a missed beat makes me reach for my revolver 9mm automatic. Now, this pisses me off. I have more compute power and bandwidth than necessary and it still doesn't work; this is just bad design. The hardware should be ready to buffer enough so it doesn't break up and the software should buffer so it always has enough data to deliver to the hardware, but no. We are now so conditioned to broken junk that we don't see it as a problem.

Perhaps I should start with the new urlLink Richard Clapton urlLink album -- Richard at his best (thanks to V). Or that I got some tips from un Moniteur so I shot urlLink better today. Or bitch that I also shot badly . Or just shut the fuck up .

Abstinence, huh? Is that a solution? I can can think of one case: If big george had abstained there would be no little george . However, if you have enough money in CONUS you can get any chimp into power as President, who'll bomb the piss out of anyone who takes their whim.

The last two times I've been down to my fave bar I've been asked: Where've you been? And, to complicate things further, both times, people have been trying to hook me up with people who might find me a job. Very strange.

So the French were sick of all these layoffs, Companies crashing and burning and the very real prospect of winding up on the streets. So, they manifesté, manifesté and manifesté . Finally they used the LAW. As a result, my twindling dole runs on for an extra seven months .

Sitting down for another night's dubious cable TV on urlLink BBC Prime I get hit by a triple whammy: urlLink Anne Robinson Ruby Wax urlLink Linda Green At least urlLink ''Mad'' Frankie Fraser was on urlLink Shooting Stars . He's the real thing. The others are just jokes.

Congress shall make no law respecting an establishment of religion, or prohibiting the free exercise thereof; or abridging the freedom of speech, or of the press; or the right of the people peaceably to assemble, and to petition the Government for a redress of grievances. So then I get told that this Amendment only applies to laws made by Congress. Err, I think the U.S. courts would should uphold this right in any circumstance. Jeez ...

So I wake up and 10 minutes later I get a call about la lettre de motivation I had written and have a 10 minute conversation on how to fix it. I had assumed that, given I had emailed it, I would get a corrected version sent bank. So, in some semi comatose state, I noted, in some bizarre shorthand, the hacks I have to make to it. Perhaps there is some method behind this.

Funny how you have to write a physical letter to Wealth Management Operations to close your account with some $AUD 18 in it. Not sure that $AUD 18 is actually wealth . urlLink Oxymoron(s) ! Oh yeah, the urlLink Shittybank (sic) are involved in this Iraq police action . But, don't let that worry you ...
It's the 22nd so my debit/ urlLink Disastercard is now ready for another caning. It's been a long month, but this card is not with those urlLink HSBC fools.
Well, with these fools jumping all over me it's time for a rear guard action . Slowly I am being forced into urlLink Death Ground and I doubt they have read Sun Tzu's urlLink The Art of War .

When I look at the human race all over the world I think there's zero reason for humanity to survive. We're destructive, uncaring, thoughtless, greedy, power hungry. But when I look at a few individuals, there seems every reason for humanity to survive. He [John Nash] was worth doing the very best for.

Holy dogshit! It's shaping up to be a bad year. I've seen this thing her, in the last week, on: urlLink The Weakest Link : Do I really need to comment on this pathetic attempt at psy-ops on retard monkeys contestants? urlLink Parky : Interviewed her about her face lift -- thrills galore [vomits]. urlLink Guess Who's Coming To Dinner : Words fail ...

Today's gem was that I finally contacted this Headhunter [jobs not scalps] who runs their local Human Resources department. They are a multinational company and their Paris office is located in ... wait for it ... trou de cul, Île de France. Just based on the postcode I could tell something was wrong. Hell, I needed my urlLink GPS to find it. Any 78000 postcode means it's a bugger to get there and often near impossible to get back from. urlLink GPS , physical maps and la urlLink SNCF web based trip guides all confirmed that it was at least a 2 klick walk across open terrain from the nearest rail station. You could try getting a cab, but ~30 klicks south west of Paris nothing is guaranteed. Looking at the roads, the cab fares, if possible, would be expensive. So, I replied outlining these various impediments, asking if there was another way to do this and added various bits of urlLink code as an incentive. An immediate reply followed. It was non . What? You can't afford to reimburse me for the cab fares? You can't afford to send someone to pick me up? What's this shit , man? What we have here is a buncha cheap, ignorant slimeballs. So, I've saved myself a wasted trip.

The economy is buggered. France and Germany have been pulled into line over their failure to adhere to the parameters of the European Monetary Union. The prices are outrageous. Should you lose your job you are in a precarious position. Once in a precarious position the Banks will beat you to death. The job market is non-existent. Maybe they even understand urlLink Zweite Neon . People who don't live it (or haven't) have no idea. I'm not French, I wasn't born in Paris but I think it's the best place for me to live; as an ex-pat I've learnt the system, the survival skills, seen the woe and know how to get out of most of it. If urlLink I had any money and could build a client base I'd build a business based on getting people out of or helping them out of their adminstrative woe. Administration is a complex thing in France. The ex-pats usually know more about it than the French because any half-way smart ex-pat has had to learn the system from zero and to take their lumps along the way.
... but applying logic to it doesn't seem to help. It appears urlLink somatic markers are part of the puzzle. Perhaps, I watch too much urlLink tv .

Ne ratez pas une occasion de vous isoler pour réfléchir au calme boyd. On parle de vous et de votre avenir professionnel mais vous ne savez pas très bien en quels termes. Il faut donc vous préparer à répondre en homme que rien n'étonne. Quel que soit votre désir, de la sécurité ou du risque, ne réagissez qu'en toute connaissance de cause. Laissez vos supérieurs ou vos partenaires formuler clairement leurs propositions...

According to urlLink Le Monde the US Military have only one urlLink M-16 round factory and it can't keep up with demand. It further states that they've had to buy urlLink M-16 ammo from their NATO buddies. Fortunately (iirc) the Brit urlLink SA-80 fires the same round, so they have some rounds to spare. This goes back to hardware chip designers: always have two plants to make your chips so if one has problems you have a fallback. Reminds me of an old 'nam joke: Got some urlLink ARVN rifles. Never been fired and only dropped once.
Phone call? What phone call? No call, no message. Why am I not surprised?

This is X, is this Y? Yes, I am. Are you free to work on job Z now? Yes. Well, I have a client who wants someone who can do Z. Could you be more specific about Z, because Z is complex? Err, no I don't have the job description from the client. Well, I can't answer your questions without more detail. I'll have the job description, tomorrow. Can I call you? Sure. What a fucking waste of time with an incompetent fool .

And no, I don't mean the game. The debt spiral has finally got me in its clutches and the way out is less than obvious . I blame the final nail on Laura Creighton urlLink <lac@strakt.com> . This deluded individual has cost me more than 30 000 € and threatened to fire me if I asked an organisational question (again) after working for urlLink AB Strakt for a month or so. Following that incident she underwent psychiatric treatment. I just walked back into my office and wondered what the fuck am I doing here ? I probably put urlLink Van Halen on and stared into my monitor. As for the 30 000 € (very much on the low side)? I asked for it and it was refused. Lawyers? I can't afford 'em. Freedom of Speech? I have that in two countries and I'm exercising it. Expect a sitrep late next week.

En ce moment, sur le plan budgétaire, vous avez plutôt tendance à manquer de discernement, boyd . Côté finances, apprenez à dire non aux sollicitations que l'on peut vous faire. Vos projets professionnels ou un achat inopiné pourraient vous poser problème. Vous devez donc, trouver séance tenante, le moyen de faire des économies. En effet, des mises à jour s'imposent sur le plan financier...

I have tried to typeset various documents using various urlLink μ$loth turds tools [Wordpad, Word] and each time, without fail, WISINWIFG [What I See Is Not What I Fucking Get]!! This will not do. And, no, it's not my eyesight. So, once I have regained composure I will rewrite my CVs in urlLink troff(1) ; a 30 year old piece of software that always gets it right.

Given this urlLink thing was created by an urlLink exception , judged in private by a bunch of exceptional Swedes and presented by The Monarch of Sweden [another exception]. I'd just like them to explain it to me how this sits with urlLink Jantelagen ? Just how noble is that?
But I really didn't know what I'd do when I found him ...
